attributes.action: Introduce a minimum 10 year jail sentence for anyone carrying a knife
attributes.background: I believe there is a minimum sentence for people convicted of carrying a knife,  or being involved in knife crime,  but it seems this is not implemented strictly enough.  As a result we are hearing of stabbing on an almost daily basis.  More needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details:
Bringing in a minimum 10 year jail sentence for anyone caught carrying a knife will act as a tough deterrent and may make people think about the consequences.  Bringing in a minimum jail term for anyone involved in knife crime, even being with someone carrying a knife,  will be a deterrent for gangs to congregate together in groups and will be less likely to go through with any knife attack without a large gang egging people on.  

More needs to be done 

Please sign my petition if you agree

attributes.action: Ensure the full payment of corporation tax on sales generated in the UK
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon the Chancellor of the Exchequer, to pilot legislation through Parliament that ensures for every pound raised in sales by any company in the United Kingdom, twenty pence is sent direct to the Treasury by means of corporation tax.

attributes.action: Introduce education on abusive relationships to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: 77% of young people claim that they do not have access to information on healthy and abusive relationships. By introducing education on abusive relationships to the National Curriculum, abuse and intimate partner violence could be prevented- saving the UK millions and reducing death rates.
attributes.additional_details: There is a shameful stigma and a culture of misinformation surrounding abuse. Seeing that education is the way forward, giving our youth the chance to learn about something that touches on the life of 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men could be crucial to achieving equality and saving lives.

attributes.action: Change the law for drink driving limit to zero and an instant ban
attributes.background:
Far to many innocent people are killed every year by drink drivers. 
It's time a stop is put to it by ways of zero tolerance and instant bans being handed out for any who fail a road side breath test.

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: Stop organisations from charging more for not making payment by Direct Debit.
attributes.background: Direct debit gives a third party open access to your wallet and bank account at any time and at will. Those who pay by other LEGAL methods are penalized with higher fees. In effect its a stealth tax charged by companies who want easy access to YOUR money. Its not right, Its not moral and its unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
If funds are not available or a payments going into account are not there on time due to bank errors or delays in employee payments or benefit payments it can cause LIFE THREATENING problems for those on a low budget as bank fees are taken from allowances put aside for food or essentials. This puts incredible pressure those on a tight budget who are hit the most with unrealistic fees for returned direct debits forcing them into further debt.

This is immoral for modern day British Companies.

attributes.action: New Prime Minister Theresa May suspend HS2 until Brexit negotiations complete
attributes.background:
Economic case for HS2 can't be justified until all Brexit negotiations complete & or 2nd referendum.
Under Brexit if carried out, London may no longer retain hub status. If Scotland negotiates to remain in EU, strong economic case for HS2 Phase1 connecting northern England with Edinburgh & Glasgow
attributes.additional_details:
Assumptions of HS2 economic projections are based on London being at focal point of connection between UK & other European countries. Logic may now not hold true.
Until full scale of Brexit negotiations are known economic case for HS2 is tenuous.
If after Brexit negotiations on UK leaving EU, Scotland negotiates to remain part of EU, perfectly conceivable Edinburgh & Glasgow could become significant economic hubs in their own right. Trade is more likely to flow via Scotland in such a scenario.

attributes.action: Non paying parents living partners income should be taken in to consideration
attributes.background: Child Maintenance should take in to consideration a non paying parents partners income whom they live with. So many parents do not pay for their children and many of these parents are actually working with either being paid cash in hand or their income being paid in to there partners bank account.
attributes.additional_details: The CSA used to take the partners income in to consideration but was later changed. Now it is easier for the non paying parent to not pay for their child which means the child is going without! I believe as many others do that if the non paying parent claims to have no income (nill rate) or little to none income and is living with their partner who is supposedly supporting them then their partners income should be considered to help pay towards the non paying parents child.

attributes.action: Stop HS2! Spend the money on the NHS
attributes.background: We need to scrap this project and reinvest the money in the NHS. Either that or refurbish the existing transport network. Save our tax money! Save our countryside! Save our towns and villages! Save our community's! And Save our homes!

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all non-vehicular road users to wear hi-viz
attributes.background: In daylight or dusk, hi-viz is highly visible to road users.  To reduce the number of accidents on the road, we call for the Government to make it a legal requirement for all road users to wear hi-viz clothing including, but not limited to, motorcyclists, cyclists, runners, walkers and horse-riders.

attributes.action: Yorkshire should secede from the UK and form its own country.
attributes.background: For years now, Yorkshire has been held back by the British government and it is time for this to end. Yorkshire needs to gain independence in order to save the Yorkshire people.

attributes.action: Instigate a root & branch review of The FA
attributes.background: Following the dismal performances of the senior England football team in the European Championships it is time for an effective review of The FA and in particular the senior England set up.
attributes.additional_details: Having failed to qualify for the European championships in 2008 a root and branch review was allegedly carried out. This has clearly had no long lasting effect on the organisation and this  petition is to request that Tracey Crouch MP, Minister for Sport brings pressure upon the FA to carry out a full review of the circumstances surrounding the failings during this championship. This should include selection of inappropriate squad players.

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: Bring in informed consent legislation for elections and referendums.
attributes.background: It is currently legal for political bodies to use false or misleading information in the run up to a vote. Introducing Free, Prior, Informed Consent(FPIC) legislation for elections would hold politicians accountable for misleading or manipulating voters as well as make sure people are aware of risks
attributes.additional_details: Many voters have said they did not fully understand the EU referendum. Politicians used false figures and misleading information in official campaigns to manipulate voters’ decisions. This impinges on voters’ right to self-determination, because they were not fully informed. There is legislation to protect the same rights in other professions, there should also be similar ones for politics and government.

attributes.action: Make an application for EU membership no later than 1 year after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
Many people who voted to leave the European Union in the June 2016 referendum have changed their minds and a clear message that EU reform is needed has been sent and, we hope, received. 
We wish, in the interests of unity and prosperity, to reclaim the UK's place in the EU.

attributes.action: RAISE Tariffs on IMPORTED steel to keep British Steel ALIVE.
attributes.background: Our manufacturing sector has been decimated over decades of neglect and a sense of simply not caring. A strong manufacturing sector constitutes a resilient, strong, diverse and booming economy. WE NEED MORE THAN JUST SERVICES. We can begin by raising tariffs on imported, cheap steel.
attributes.additional_details: Our Steel Industry has been decimated over the years by cheap Chinese and other low labour cost nation imports. LEVY IT. This will promote projects within the UK to use British Steel thus reviving the industry, producing jobs and a renewed sense of pride within ourselves. Moreover, to support and kick start this I want capital, state projects to ONLY use British Steel. Beginning with HS2 and other ongoing projects. I believe this will boost economic output and GDP and benefit us all immensely.

attributes.action: Make it legal to listen to broadcasts not meant for the general public. (ATC)
attributes.background: It is illegal to provide air traffic control feeds from within the UK due to an outdated law that originated in 1942. The law states that although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant to be broadcast to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
OfCom (the U.K. regulatory authority for communications) has stated on numerous occasions: "It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so." 

This means that it is illegal to listen to anything other than general reception. This is clearly a law that needs to be updated in light of the many educational uses for listening to aircraft communications. Furthermore, the original reasons for this law have long since become irrelevant.

attributes.action: Define rights of EU citizens currently living in Britain after leaving the EU
attributes.background:
There are many EU citizens who have been living and working in Britain for many years, and built lives here

Once Clause 50 is enacted, nothing will definite their status.
However, the British Parliament can define immediately what rights these people have once we are no longer in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Some EU citizens have lived here for decades, worked, paid taxes, and contributed to the British Economy.
No timeline has been given by Parliament to start, and it can take up to two years to complete
It is unfair to expect tax paying people to endure this period of uncertainty in their lives.  This decision does not need to wait for EU negotiations to begin, or await a new prime minister – it can be enacted with immediate effect, as this right will be the responsibility of the British People

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: Give the rest of the UK a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain.
attributes.background: If Scotland decides on a 2nd referendum to leave or remain with the UK then the rest of the UK simultaneously should have a referendum as to whether they wish Scotland to remain. If EITHER referendum indicate that Scotland should leave then they must leave the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The future of the UK should be decided by all of the residents of the UK and not just a minority.

attributes.action: Make petrol tax cheaper for sports car drivers
attributes.background: Because driving and running costs are already a lot. Petrol shouldn't be over priced so people can't drive how they want to drive Thierry performance cars

attributes.action: Make it a requirement to hold a UK Election within a year of any change of PM
attributes.background: New PM'S should have a mandate from the people they govern, rather than a few party members.  As such a new UK GENERAL Election should be held within 1 year of a new PM being appointed so he or she can claim to lead the People as PM with a proper mandate.

attributes.action: Set a date for a Scotland independence referendum
attributes.background: The U.K. Eu referendum result is not supported by the majority in Scotland. A further referendum should be run to determine if Scotland wishes to remain in Europe.

attributes.action: For EU motions to be urgently debated in Parliament offering a range of outcomes
attributes.background: Next steps for Parliament is far from clear or defined in law. An urgent Commons debate should offer a range of motions from each side of the campaign with full analysis of issues and offering a range of options moving forward. Any parliamentary outcome should be accompanied by wider consultation.

attributes.action: Don't Hold a General Election on account of result of EU Referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has now entered a period of unparalleled uncertainty and this uncertainty is the biggest threat to continuing UK financial stability. 
Financial markets are already unsettled as it is, and a General Election would prolong the uncertainty and economic fallout of Brexit, at everyone's expense.
attributes.additional_details: Uncertainty over the outcome of the EU Referendum already had a significant impact on the UK economy prior to this vote, with foreign direct investment being put on hold as well as stock markets and sterling becoming increasingly volatile. Now a vote to leave has prolonged this period of uncertainty and is likely to have a significant short term economic impact. It is vital that a General Election is not called to ensure that the financial fallout of Brexit is not prolonged for UK households.

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: Reinstate the personal tax allowance for people earning over £100,000 pa.
attributes.background: Tax system flaws leave professionals paying 60 per cent tax, yet those on higher income pay just 45%.
attributes.additional_details:
Above the £10,600 tax-free personal allowance there are three bands of income tax people pay on earnings: 20pc (basic rate - from £10,600), 40pc (higher rate - from £42,385) and 45pc (additional rate - from £150,000). 

But people earning over £100,000 gradually have their personal allowance removed at a rate of £1 for every £2 earned above the threshold, up to £121,200. This means a "fourth" band of "marginal tax" is created in which they pay 60pc on income in between these levels, plus 2pc for national insurance, a total rate of 62pc. 
Workers pocket just 38pc of the income they earn between these levels. It means, ludicrously, that they pay a higher marginal tax rate than people who earn far more.

attributes.action: Send all foreign prisoners back to their countries of origin and ban them.
attributes.background: We have seen on recent BBC news programmes that the UK prison service is in a dire straight. Lack of funding, violent and dangerous it is another failing part of the UK.  Foreign criminals, many from the EU now make up a significant part of the UK inmates and are costing us a fortune.

attributes.action: Compel Bookmakers to accept £100 wagers and ban closing accounts
attributes.background: Bookmakers are systematically closing accounts of any punter with even short term profits.this is totally contrary to them being licenced to accepting bets.A modest figure of £100 would hardly lay them open to nefarious acts but would equally give a fair deal.
attributes.additional_details: I am sure several thousands respondents will support this ,all with similar stories.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, on Section 75 Credit Act to apply on debit cards.
attributes.background: A petition calling on Parliament to change the law, so that Section 75 of the Consumer Credit Act applies to debit cards in the same way that it applies to credit cards.
attributes.additional_details:
MAKE BANKS TO REFUND CHARGEBACK TO SMALL BUSINESS VICTIMS OF FRAUD.

Bank don’t pay chargeback on a debit card, fraud is no legal obligation as in Section 75 with Credit Cards. As a small business sole trader I became a victim of fraud losing £4271.39 to a supplier in Holland.

I wrote to Action fraud, the British police, the Dutch police, the Dutch embassy in London still no one can help, I went to the citizen advice, and even my MP tried to help but dead end. I believe banks should consider and realise how small businesses are affected by fraudsters and chargeback accordingly to exceptional circumstances. It is unbelievable that in such according to my experience no one is helping.

attributes.action: Teach about the full LGBTQ* spectrum as part of the PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: If the government made it mandatory for students to be taught about the LGBTQ* spectrum I feel it would drastically decrease bullying and ignorance, as well as making students possibly feel better about themselves if they understand that their feelings are normal.
attributes.additional_details: As a high school student myself I have noticed a distinct lack of education regarding LGBTQ* people, despite the fact that 1 in every 10 people is either lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender.

attributes.action: Replace extortionate fees (24%) charged to parents by CMS with standard fee.
attributes.background: Paying parent pays 20% - receiving parent pays 4% to CMS for setting up direct debit.  Fees are disproportionate to the effort required by CMS to effect payment.  Fees are significantly more than fees charged to make simple bank transfer or BACS payment, regardless of the amount involved.
attributes.additional_details: The 24% charge is a standard charge, whether payment is £1 or £1000.  This fee amounts to a lot for some paying parents and represents money that could be better spent on the children.  The CMS should at least explain the reasons for this extortionate fee level, and be transparent about what they actually do to deserve such a fee.  Monies already paid by parents should receive a refund along the lines of the PPI scandal.  (Will give CMS something to do!)

attributes.action: Reform faith school's religious studies to follow the National Curriculum
attributes.background:
Faith schools are mostly run like other state schools. They have to follow the national curriculum except for religious studies, where they are free to only teach about their own religion.

The exclusion of other religions does not open students to other faiths and promotes ignorance.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/types-of-school/faith-schools

attributes.action: Ban GMO crops in the UK
attributes.background:
Ban GMO (Genetically Modified) Crops in the UK because of:
1. its influence on human health is questionable.
2. once any plant is introduced in the ecosystem it is almost impossible to eradicate it
3. Food label does not show GMO content
attributes.additional_details:
Ban GMO (Genetically Modified) Crops in the UK because of:
1. its influence on human health is questionable (see http://www.motherearthnews.com/natural-health/nutrition/gmo-safety-zmgz13amzsto.aspx)
2. once any plant is introduced in the ecosystem it is almost impossible to eradicate it
3. food is not labelled correctly - it is not shown if food does contain the GMOs
4. special pesticides are used to protect GMO crops and they are dangerous to humans and environment

attributes.action: Change the law to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition is change the law, to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence, with specific minimum punishments for those convicted.
With social media becoming the main portal for people to share their lives with others, cyber bullying is on the increase.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullies must face harsher punishments. With self harming and suicide on the rise, social media truly does play a part with it being noted that all teenagers who socialise online will come across cyber bullying at least once. However, it is not just teenagers who are subjected to this online torture, with the internet becoming the new venue to host the modern day witch hunt. It is time that cyber bullies were held accountable and suitably sentenced for their actions.

attributes.action: Make Mondays part of the weekend every week.
attributes.background: We all work too hard and we need more time off.
attributes.additional_details: It's as simple as that.

attributes.action: Increase refuge spaces for male survivors of domestic violence
attributes.background: Currently there are only 11 government funded refuge places for male survivors of domestic violence yet 40% of domestic violence is against males

attributes.action: Spend revenue from closing tax loopholes on carbon capture & storage technology
attributes.background: I think a percentage of the money the government gains from closing tax loopholes should be invested. The single biggest threat facing the world is global warming. A lot of money is being invested in renewables but not enough into capturing carbon from existing fossil fuel consumption.
attributes.additional_details: There is a technology called Carbon Capture & Storage (CCS). This captures up to 90% of the carbon from fossil fuel power stations and other industry when it is fitted. If more money was invested in this technology, it would reduce the manufacturing cost more companies could start fitting it to new power stations and possibly existing power stations and industry thus reducing emissions.

attributes.action: Allow katy James to stay in the Uk with her husband and 2 year old daughter!
attributes.background:
Katy has been married to her husband Dominic for 9 years and they have a 2 year old daughter, Katy has been denied a visa because her husband doesn't "earn enough"

This is unfair and no parent should be seperated from their child

attributes.action: DVLA need a telephone customer department that corrects the mistakes they  make
attributes.background:
DVLA fined us for their mistake with our DIrect Debit.
It has been shocking to find they have no telephone service for their mistakes to be sorted out.  Only telephone lines to pay the "fine" even when you don't owe them it. Very stressful time trying to sort it out.

attributes.action: all petitions with over 200000 signatures put to uk general election style vote
attributes.background:
petitions are often signed and not even discussed in parmlimant this gives the uk public a lack of confidence in the whole petition consept 
if every petition that reached 200000 signatures had to be voted on in an election style vote uk opinons would be voiced from the people for the people
attributes.additional_details:
this concept could be easily implimented by adding all succsesfull petitons to local and or general election questionares forms and voted on the same day reducing cost and increasing likelyhood to vote

the number 200000 is only a ballpar amount of votes if sucsesfull the amount of signature could be agreed upon for less or more but a garuntee of public intrest in the petiton idea would sertainly be sparked because the whole petition basis would have a more definative and resolved end result

attributes.action: Abolish corporation tax and impose a land value tax of 1%.
attributes.background: Corporation tax is as outdated as window tax. Only small and poor companies pay it, the big and rich companies do not. It is a pointless, optional tax that diverts brainpower away from constructive applications. Scrap it. A land value tax of 1% will bring in more money and cannot be dodged.
attributes.additional_details: Corporation tax dates from a time when the biggest enterprises were steel works and railways, not search engines and social networks. We should stop complaining about tax havens and become one.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of a famous woman on Parliament square.
attributes.background: Parliament Square has statues of famous men in history. There are many women of importance that have contributed to our democracy surely this should be reflected in our most important landmark. Example Emily Pankhurst helped give women the vote.

attributes.action: Whilst respecting Freedom of Speech Laws, Holocaust denial should be a crime.
attributes.background: The Holocaust saw 6 million Jews and countless millions of others executed in concentration camps. The Holocaust is a historical fact taught in our schools. Whilst we have freedom of speech, we should specifically criminalise it's denial as it can be used to further anti-semitism within our society.
attributes.additional_details: A number of countries have laws against denying the Holocaust and many historians and politicians have stated that it has enabled anti-semitism to be tackled more proactively. In some European countries there are increasingly greater numbers of anti-semitic attacks and hate crimes, as well as the election of anti-semitic parties. In Britain anti-semitism is sadly rising as official reported crime figures show. Anti-Semitic hate crimes are already criminalised, but denial of the Holocaust is not.

attributes.action: Lower the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the equivalent of Scotland
attributes.background:
In England and Wales, the alcohol limit for drivers is 80 milligrammes of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. On December 5th 2014 the alcohol limit for drivers in Scotland reduced from 80 to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood.
This is far safer.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Government say they have changed their drink drive limit to bring Scotland in line with most other European countries, to save lives and make Scotland’s roads safer.
Many of the functions that we depend on to drive safely are affected when we drink alcohol: 
the brain takes longer to receive messages from the eye
processing information becomes more difficult
slower reaction times.
blurred and double vision, affects your ability to see things clearly while you are driving.

attributes.action: Raise the lifetime ISA upper age limit from 40 to 45.
attributes.background: The 40 year upper limit for the new life time ISA is too low. People upto the age of 45 should have this opportunity as well.

attributes.action: Introduce other religious leaders into the house of lords to make it democratic
attributes.background: The only religious leaders in the House of Lords are bishops and arch bishops but as Britain is now a multi faith country other religious leaders from Muslim, Hindu and Sikh (etc) faiths should be entered to the house in order to offer greater representation and democracy and scrutiny in Britain.
